subject: Running
Track and Field
Olympic Games (2008)
lead_paragraph: Haile Gebrselassie ran his fastest 10,000 meters in four years at the FBK Games in Hengelo, Netherlands, as he pushed his case to be included on the Ethiopian Olympic team. Gebrselassie finished second in 26 minutes 51.20 seconds, only 0.67 behind his compatriot Sileshi Sihine. Gebrselassie, who runs mostly marathons, said he would not run the marathon at the Beijing Olympics because the smog and heat might bother his asthma.
